data.title: Feature request: Escape key should not exit zen mode, Ctrl+W should not exit VSCode
data.body:
While I'm editting in Zen mode I may open a search dialog, and then after finding something I may make a selection and hit Ctrl+D a bunch of times to select throughout the document and finally I will make my edits. To return to a single cursor state with the find window closed I usually hit escape 5 or 6 times in sequence. In regular mode this is not an issue, in Zen mode this drops me out of zen mode entirely. Can we get an option to disable the "escape zen mode" keyboard shortcut? I feel leaving Zen mode should be a more deliberate action.

In addition while I'm editting in VSCode in Zen mode, I may have multiple files open in the same tab. Eventually I get to a point where I feel comfortable closing out all of those files and starting from a clean slate. In this case I'll rapidly hit Ctrl+W and watch the files disappear, however unexpectedly when I hit Ctrl+W with no tabs open VSCode shutsdown entirely. I don't know of any other program that does this, except for maybe chrome where no tabs = no program. I feel this should be rectified entirely (not just hidden behind an option).

VSCode is awesome, thanks so much for building and maintaining it.

data.title: SimpleFindWidget Add next,previous,history: Fixes #29708 #29661
data.body:
@rebornix 
@Tyriar 
- Of course the last five percent was all the work
- The need for a new context for FindInput Focused was somewhat messy
- Had to touch more files than expected, was necessary as there are four clients 
- Re-FactoringTheFindWidget for common use everywhere will take quite a bit of work
  since it's so intertwined with the editor
- Hopefully this is useful until we re- factor that


 Fixes #29708 #29661 also services the modified simpleFindWidget to all users

data.title: HTML Comments not aligned properly after uncommenting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- vsc-material-theme|Equ|1.0.2 beautify|Hoo|1.1.1 code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2 quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.46 npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 gitignore|cod|0.5.0 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 githistory|don|0.2.3 vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7 vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0 auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3 auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14 code-runner|for|0.6.32 docthis|joe|0.4.7 vue|liu|0.1.5 ecdc|mit|0.10.3 vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.1.1 vscode-csscomb|mrm|4.0.1 vscode-scss|mrm|0.6.2 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7 vetur|oct|0.9.3 rewrap|stk|1.4.2 code-spell-checker|str|1.3.4 vscode-todo-highlight|way|0.5.8 better-align|wwm|1.1.6 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add HTML ```html

Line 1

Line 2

``` 2. Comment a line ```html

Line 1

``` 3. Toggle the comment. Notice that toggled line is not properly aligned (there is an unwanted space before the opening `

` tag and after the closing `

` tag). ```html

Line 1

Line 2

``` To further demonstrate the issue, repeatedly toggle the line comment on/off. Below is the result of toggling the same line on/off ten times. ```html

Line 1

``` Multi-line comments are also affected. Below is the result of toggling the entire block of HTML on/off ten times: ```html ``` I believe the expected behavior is for a toggled comment to restore the line's original alignment much like other toggled comments do. It appears that the issue is caused by space characters that are added when commenting (``) which are not removed when uncommenting (only `` are removed). Reproduces without extensions: Yes Thanks!

data.title: Extend/Shrink Selection Scope
data.body:
Users shall be able to successively select expanding logical blocks of code so that you can easily select any expression in the code by placing the caret somewhere inside it and pressing a shortcut.

Extends selection to the next containing node (for example, an expression, a paired tag, an entire conditional block, a method body, a class, a group of vararg arguments, etc.)

In plain text, with the caret anywhere in a word, the selection would extend to to the word, the sentence, the paragraph

Shrink does the opposite.

Examples

![ext1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/957271/29006090-f158a6be-7b23-11e7-9b52-f67ce1d57c4b.gif)
![ext2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/957271/29006092-f2e4302a-7b23-11e7-95ee-38ab89ac6f7a.gif)
![ext3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/957271/29006095-f4c3089e-7b23-11e7-8c08-661b1362d54f.gif)

data.title: VS Code Windows installer unnecessarily slow due to text rendering
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16257
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install an update or new version of VS Code.
2. Observe system CPU usage and how long the installer takes.

VS Code's Windows installer appears to be CPU-bound. The installer has to copy a large number of small files (particularly in node_modules). It also appears to update a string in the UI with the name of the current file being copied. Text layout and rendering is a CPU-expensive operation, and the CPU overhead of updating the UI string with the current filename can be larger than the actual time it takes to copy the file. Therefore installation time is mainly bound on how quickly the system can layout and render text, rather than I/O performance. This is the same reason modern versions of Windows throttle the updates when copying files to ~4 times a second, since it helps achieve better throughput with fast storage.

I would guess VS Code's installer could be a lot faster if it did the same kind of throttling, and that would be nice to make update prompts less inconvenient.

data.title: Setting to Open VSCode with Open Editors Closed
data.body:
By default, when you open a project in VSCode it always has the Open Editors tab open in the side column. As you start working, all the open files show up here, pushing your project files below it down. 

![open editor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/249218/29004354-e3c24932-7a7a-11e7-9c77-a4c64baae518.png)

I always have to immediately close the Open Editors tab to stop it from pushing all my files down. I'd prefer a user setting like:
```
{
   editor.openEditors: false
}
```
That way Open Editors would be closed when I open VSCode.

data.title: Use vscode as textarea in my webpage to edit code
data.body:
I have a website built by mean-stack, and a page containing a textarea to edit some web code (html & css & javascript) like a playground. I used to use `ui-codemirror` and `ui-ace` to implement this textarea, but now, I am wondering if it is possible to use vscode?

So my questions are:

1. is it legal, given the IP of my website does not belong to Microsoft?
2. does vscode work well with angularjs 1.6 or 1.5 (ie, `ng-model`)?
3. is there any tutorial to let me get started?

Thank you

data.title: Feature request: Action for opening a new integrated terminal with a non-default shell
data.body:
There is currently a keyboard shortcut mapping for `workbench.action.terminal.new`, which opens a new terminal instance of the default shell type. There's also a mapping for `workbench.action.terminal.selectDefaultShell`, although I can't find a setting in `settings.json` that this changes.

I'd like to see a new action, e.g. `workbench.action.terminal.newNonDefault`, which opens up the same select list as for `selectDefaultShell` but instead of setting the default, just opens an instance of the selected type. This would enable me to have PowerShell as my default, but open a bash or cmd shell every now and then without having to change the default back and forth.

data.title: Disable auto-completion for Chinese language
data.body:
I am now using VS Code to writing some articles in Chinese language. However, the auto-completion is annoying when typing Chinese words.

Look at this picture. Even when I type into a comma, it will give you some advice. Really unnecessary!

![default](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18233088/29000024-c8242892-7a90-11e7-8a60-7e32fd625db1.png)

How to disable auto-completion *only* for Chinese language? Or at least I hope to disable it at specific characters like punctuations (eg. `，`, `；` and `。` in Chinese).

- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

PS: I'm writing LaTeX articles with extension LaTeX Workshop.

data.title: Bug in stylelint: Value is not accepted. Valid values: ["between-comments","stylelint-commands"]
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install this [stylelint](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=shinnn.stylelint) extension
2. Add a `.stylelintrc.json`  file
3. Copy the stylelint configuration from https://stylelint.io/demo/ and paste it on `.stylelintrc.json` 
4. Add a `"after-comment"` option to the `ignore` of `comment-empty-line-before`. Your code should look like this:
```
      "comment-empty-line-before": [
        "always",
        {
          "except": [
            "first-nested"
          ],
          "ignore": [
            "after-comment", "stylelint-commands"
          ]
        }
      ],
```
Reproduces without extensions: No

I have checked the extension source code and it uses **stylelint 8.0.0**
